meanings.definition: To make something individual or unique to a particular person.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys personalising her gifts by adding special touches for each friend.
meanings.sent2: I am personalising this card with your name to make it special for you.
meanings.sent3: The robot insisted on personalising its greeting for every guest, causing laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic flair in personalising each piece of jewelry made her stand out.
meanings.sent5: The chef's way of personalising each dish made the dining experience unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To tailor something to suit an individual's preferences or needs.
meanings.sent1: He is personalising the training program to meet each employee's learning style.
meanings.sent2: The company is personalising their services to better cater to customer needs.
meanings.sent3: The tailor had a unique way of personalising each suit, making them truly one-of-a-kind.
meanings.sent4: She was personalising her approach to coaching, ensuring each player's success.
meanings.sent5: The artist's skill in personalising portraits captured the essence of each subject.
